<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
SPORTS
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/03/19/business-march-madness?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
710 Days Later…
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="March Madness logo" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC80NDUxL21hcmNoX21hZG5lc3MuanBnIiwiYnVja2V0Ijoib3Nsby1wcm9kdWN0aW9uIiwiZWRpdHMiOnsicmVzaXplIjp7IndpZHRoIjoxMDAwLCJoZWlnaHQiOm51bGx9fX0=">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Patrick Smith/Getty Images</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The best three weeks in sports is back. The first round of the NCAA men’s basketball tournament <a href="https://apnews.com/article/norfolk-norfolk-state-spartans-mens-basketball-coronavirus-pandemic-michigan-state-spartans-mens-basketball-texas-b6884117be1ae15545d616844df19f74?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">kicked off</a> yesterday in Indiana, finally adding some non-Covid madness (lookin' at you Oral Roberts) back to the month of March and filling the hole created by the pandemic last year. </p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">The tournament is big money</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">For the NCAA: </strong>The D1 men’s tournament accounted for 79% of the $1.1 billion the organization brought in during the 2019 fiscal year. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">For schools: </strong>The NCAA has a pool of money that factors in results of the men’s tournament, dishing out one “unit” for each game a team plays until the Final Four. The further a team advances in the tournament, the more money the team’s conference is paid by the NCAA on a rolling 6-year basis.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>As of 2019, each unit was worth $280,000, which means that a run to the Final Four could generate around $1.1 million for a conference every season for the next six years. </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">One March participant that is conspicuously absent from this agreement: women’s teams. The NCAA still <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/march-madness-womens-college-basketball-ncaa-tournament-11616155596?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">doesn’t factor</a> the performance of a school’s women’s basketball program into its total March Madness revenue distribution.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The women’s tournament isn’t revenue-generating, according to the NCAA. But TV ratings are on the rise—more than 3.6 million viewers watched the 2019 championship game, up 24% from 2016—which means a more lucrative broadcast deal could be on the horizon. The women’s tournament kicks off tomorrow in a “bubble” in San Antonio.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">For gamblers: </strong>Research from PlayUSA projects that this year’s tournament could generate as much as <a href="https://www.foxbusiness.com/sports/2021-ncaa-march-madness-fans-opening-wallets-in-big-way?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">$1.5 billion</a> in legal bets. For context, Legal Sports Report estimated that $462.4 million was legally wagered on this year’s Super Bowl.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Investors are getting in on the action. Yesterday, shares of Barstool Sports owner Penn National Gaming and sports betting app DraftKings jumped 4.9% and 6.5%, respectively. </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">+ Some fun bracket math to take you into the weekend.</strong> According to the NCAA, the odds of filling out a perfect bracket are 1-in-9,223,372,036,854,775,808 (if you just guess or flip a coin) and 1-in-120.2 billion (if you know a little something about basketball). </p>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
COVID
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/03/19/vaccine-tracker-march-20?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Vaccine Tracker
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Vaccine tracker" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC80MjA0L3ZhY2NpbmVfdHJhY2tlci5KUEciLCJidWNrZXQiOiJvc2xvLXByb2R1Y3Rpb24iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Francis Scialabba</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">In the US...</strong>we’ve now administered more than 100 million doses, a goal President Biden set out to achieve in his first 100 days in office (it’s his 59th today). Nearly a <a href="https://www.washingtonpost.com/graphics/2020/health/covid-vaccine-states-distribution-doses/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">quarter of all Americans</a> have received at least one dose of a Covid-19 vaccine. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Across the world...</strong>we’re getting close to half a billion vaccine doses administered. As of last night, 133 countries had given out more than 420 million shots.</p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">The latest headlines</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Astra drama: </strong>The WHO <a href="https://www.reuters.com/article/us-health-coronavirus-who-astrazeneca/keep-using-astrazeneca-vaccine-who-urges-world-idUSKBN2BB1UL?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">urged the world</a> to continue using AstraZeneca’s vaccine following blood clot concerns in Europe. UK Prime Minister Boris Johnson <a href="https://www.axios.com/boris-johnson-first-dose-astrazeneca-vaccine-42e17216-fee1-457c-ae96-f95b769b4b89.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">got the Astra shot</a> yesterday to show it can be trusted.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Third waves:</strong> The German health minister warned that Covid-19 cases are rising at an “<a href="https://www.dw.com/en/germany-weighs-longer-covid-lockdown-amid-exponential-rise/a-56924921?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">exponential rate</a>” and the pace of the vaccine rollout isn’t fast enough to prevent a third wave. Paris entered lockdown mode yesterday. Meanwhile, Brazil’s health system is in a <a href="https://www.theguardian.com/world/2021/mar/19/brazil-coronavirus-intensive-care-unit-capacity?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">state of crisis</a> as cases surge.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">More eligibility: </strong>Florida is <a href="https://www.nbcmiami.com/news/local/gov-ron-desantis-to-lower-vaccine-eligibility-age-to-50-and-over/2409609/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">opening up</a> vaccine eligibility to anyone 50 or over starting Monday.<strong style="color:#000"> </strong></p>

<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
GEOPOLITICS
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/03/19/china-adds-restrictions-tesla-security-reasons?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Dude, Where’s My Tesla?
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/03/19/china-adds-restrictions-tesla-security-reasons" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<img alt="Tesla with wheel lock" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8zNzMzL3Rlc2xhX3dpdGhfd2hlZWxfbG9jay5qcGciLCJidWNrZXQiOiJvc2xvLXByb2R1Y3Rpb24iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Francis Scialabba</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The Chinese government is putting the Technoking on notice. It’s a) banned Teslas from entering military complexes and housing compounds and b) curbed the use of Teslas by military staff and employees of key state-owned companies, per <a href="https://www.reuters.com/article/us-tesla-china/tesla-cars-banned-from-chinas-military-complexes-on-security-concerns-sources-idUSKBN2BB18R?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">multiple</a> <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/china-to-restrict-tesla-usage-by-military-and-state-personnel-11616155643?mod=hp_lead_pos2&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">reports</a>. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">The explanation: </strong></span><span>Beijing thinks Teslas could be the 21st-century version of the Trojan horse. The government is reportedly worried that the cars’ built-in cameras could collect sensitive data and potentially send it back to the US.</span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">If you’re having déjà vu, it’s because the White House has blocked Chinese tech companies from operating in the US due to similar concerns over snooping. Remember Huawei? </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Why it matters for Tesla: </strong>China is a <a href="https://finance.yahoo.com/news/china-restricting-tesla-use-uncovers-a-significant-challenge-for-elon-musk-expert-161921664.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">critical market</a> for the company, so it wants to avoid any political controversies as it makes inroads. Chinese sales accounted for about 21% of Tesla’s total revenue in 2020, and with a new Shanghai Gigafactory churning out the Model 3 and Model Y, it wants that share to grow. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Big picture: </strong>Yesterday, the US and China wrapped up two days of talks in Alaska. <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2021/03/19/world/asia/china-us-alaska.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">It didn’t go well</a>.</p>

<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
SPONSORED BY BOMBAY
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="#" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
The Quest for the Best Gin Starts with a Ques-Gin
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a href="https://attach.mikmak.tv/0f5477f1/6bc30367-487f-a42f-831c-bcf4715b2c6c?channelType=email&trafficType=paid&attachCampaignName=q4-morning-brew-stir-creativity&handle=bombay-sapphire&platformType=email&adPlacementType=na&adUnitType=static-ad&paidAudienceType=morning-brew-newsletter-subscribers&adUnitCreative=newsletter-daily-brew-primary-310&campaignObjectiveType=awareness" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<img alt="Bombay" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL3BsYWNlbWVudC9pbWFnZXMvMjc4Ny8xNjE1MjMxOTE2LU1vcm5pbmdCcmV3XzFfMTUwMHg4NTAucG5nIiwiYnVja2V0IjoiY29tZXQtbW9ybmluZ2JyZXciLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em></em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><em>How is a fresher, more balanced gin actually made? </em></p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">To help answer that excellent ques-gin, let’s first talk about how the brightest gins are <em>not </em>made. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Most gins out there boil down their botanicals—a rough process you would only subject an innocent potato to.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><a href="https://attach.mikmak.tv/0f5477f1/6bc30367-487f-a42f-831c-bcf4715b2c6c?channelType=email&trafficType=paid&attachCampaignName=q4-morning-brew-stir-creativity&handle=bombay-sapphire&platformType=email&adPlacementType=na&adUnitType=static-ad&paidAudienceType=morning-brew-newsletter-subscribers&adUnitCreative=newsletter-daily-brew-primary-310&campaignObjectiveType=awareness" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Bombay Sapphire</a> does things differently—or should we say, delicately. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">They’ve perfected a <strong style="color:#000">unique production process known as vapor-infusion</strong>, using steam from the rising alcohol vapor during distillation to <strong style="color:#000">gently extract the flavors of all-natural and sustainably-sourced botanicals.</strong></p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The result? <a href="https://attach.mikmak.tv/0f5477f1/6bc30367-487f-a42f-831c-bcf4715b2c6c?channelType=email&trafficType=paid&attachCampaignName=q4-morning-brew-stir-creativity&handle=bombay-sapphire&platformType=email&adPlacementType=na&adUnitType=static-ad&paidAudienceType=morning-brew-newsletter-subscribers&adUnitCreative=newsletter-daily-brew-primary-310&campaignObjectiveType=awareness" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">A vibrant and beautifully balanced liquid</a> worthy of the Bombay name.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Friends, your standard G and T doesn’t have to be a mix of boiled down juniper and a splash of bubbles. Level up with <strong style="color:#000">Bombay botanicals, premium tonic, and your favorite garnish</strong>.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><a href="https://attach.mikmak.tv/0f5477f1/6bc30367-487f-a42f-831c-bcf4715b2c6c?channelType=email&trafficType=paid&attachCampaignName=q4-morning-brew-stir-creativity&handle=bombay-sapphire&platformType=email&adPlacementType=na&adUnitType=static-ad&paidAudienceType=morning-brew-newsletter-subscribers&adUnitCreative=newsletter-daily-brew-primary-310&campaignObjectiveType=awareness" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Your Saturday just got better with Bombay</a>. </p>

<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">

<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Stat: </strong><em>The Simpsons</em> will air its <a href="https://variety.com/2021/tv/news/the-simpsons-700-episodes-clip-al-jean-1234934371/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">700th episode</a> Sunday evening. It would take another 12 years for the show to hit 1,000, but never say never—it’s been renewed through 2023, which means it’ll hit at least 757 episodes.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Quote: </strong>“If the value increases, they could have an extremely valuable fart on their hands.”</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Film director Alex Ramírez-Mallis told the NY Post he thinks the buyer of his farts could see a significant return on their investment. For some context: He’s selling a year’s worth of <a href="https://nypost.com/2021/03/18/nyc-man-sells-fart-for-85-cashing-in-on-nft-craze/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">fart audio clips</a> recorded during quarantine as an NFT. You can also buy individual fart recordings for $85 a toot. </p>

<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
ALCOHOL
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/03/19/three-new-hard-seltzers-spring?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Beverage Brands Go Hard
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Cacti agave hard seltzer 9-pack with mic leaning on box " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC80Mzg4L2NhY3RpX2FnYXZlX2hhcmRfc2VsdHplci5qcGciLCJidWNrZXQiOiJvc2xvLXByb2R1Y3Rpb24iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Francis Scialabba</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The “no laws when you’re drinking Claws” lifestyle may be lost to 2019, but hard seltzer has since updated its bio from “trend” to “staple.” Nielsen found there are more than <a href="https://www.ft.com/content/39360401-7370-402f-8af5-641ebf04a57f?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">65 brands</a> in stores this year, up from 26 in 2019. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">This week, rapper Travis Scott’s Cacti Hard Seltzer <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/retail/stories/2021/03/15/travis-scott-launches-cacti-hard-seltzer-brand?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">hit shelves</a> and promptly sold out. Topo Chico, owned by Coca-Cola, and Spindrift have announced their hard seltzers <a href="https://www.eater.com/2021/3/19/22339908/topo-chico-hard-seltzer-spindrift-spiked-truly-white-claw-trend?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">will arrive</a> within the next two months.</p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Is there room for so many tall cans?</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">White Claw and Truly dominate the hard seltzer scene, with a combined 75% market share as of last June. But that might not matter for brands entering the space, because there’s more seltzer sommeliers than ever: Total US sales more than doubled from 2018 to 2020 to $4.1 billion. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Zoom out: </strong>We’ll find out soon whether post-Covid life is more <em>American Pie</em> or apple pie, but expect hard seltzer to play a big role either way: Research company Bernstein estimates hard seltzer will make up more than 15% of the beer and cider market by 2024. </p>

The policy change is aimed at getting more kids to go to school in-person.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eMarkets: \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003eThe Dow and S\u0026P \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2021/03/18/stock-market-open-to-close-news.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003esnapped\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e a two-week winning streak, while the Nasdaq has dropped four weeks out of the last five.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eGovernment: \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003ePresident Biden and VP Harris \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/live/2021/03/19/us/atlanta-shootings-massage-spa?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eaddressed\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e the recent spike in anti-Asian violence following the killing of eight people, including six women of Asian descent, in metro Atlanta. \"Our silence is complicity. We cannot be complicit,\" Biden said.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003c/th\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003c!--[if !mso ]\u003e\u003c! -- --\u003e\n\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003c!-- \u003c![endif]--\u003e\n\u003c!-- END MARKETS --\u003e\n\u003c!-- ARTICLE ---\u003e\n\u003c!--[if !mso ]\u003e\u003c! -- --\u003e\n\u003cdiv class=\"c6 \" style=\"margin-bottom:7px\"\u003e\n\u003c!-- \u003c![endif]--\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003cth class=\"card\" style=\"text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px\"\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding: 15px;\"\u003e\n\u003ch3 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0\"\u003e\nSPORTS\n\u003c/h3\u003e\n\u003ch1 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px\"\u003e\n\u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/03/19/business-march-madness?email={{profile.email}}\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;\"\u003e\n\u003cfont color=\"#000000\"\u003e\n710 Days Later…\n\u003c/font\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003c/h1\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003cimg alt=\"March Madness logo\" style=\"display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;\" width=\"670\" class=\"story-header-image\" src=\"https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC80NDUxL21hcmNoX21hZG5lc3MuanBnIiwiYnVja2V0Ijoib3Nsby1wcm9kdWN0aW9uIiwiZWRpdHMiOnsicmVzaXplIjp7IndpZHRoIjoxMDAwLCJoZWlnaHQiOm51bGx9fX0=\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;\"\u003e\n\u003csmall\u003e\u003cem\u003ePatrick Smith/Getty Images\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe best three weeks in sports is back. The first round of the NCAA men’s basketball tournament \u003ca href=\"https://apnews.com/article/norfolk-norfolk-state-spartans-mens-basketball-coronavirus-pandemic-michigan-state-spartans-mens-basketball-texas-b6884117be1ae15545d616844df19f74?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ekicked off\u003c/a\u003e yesterday in Indiana, finally adding some non-Covid madness (lookin' at you Oral Roberts) back to the month of March and filling the hole created by the pandemic last year. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eThe tournament is big money\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eFor the NCAA: \u003c/strong\u003eThe D1 men’s tournament accounted for 79% of the $1.1 billion the organization brought in during the 2019 fiscal year. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eFor schools: \u003c/strong\u003eThe NCAA has a pool of money that factors in results of the men’s tournament, dishing out one “unit” for each game a team plays until the Final Four. The further a team advances in the tournament, the more money the team’s conference is paid by the NCAA on a rolling 6-year basis.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eAs of 2019, each unit was worth $280,000, which means that a run to the Final Four could generate around $1.1 million for a conference every season for the next six years. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eOne March participant that is conspicuously absent from this agreement: women’s teams. The NCAA still \u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/march-madness-womens-college-basketball-ncaa-tournament-11616155596?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003edoesn’t factor\u003c/a\u003e the performance of a school’s women’s basketball program into its total March Madness revenue distribution.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe women’s tournament isn’t revenue-generating, according to the NCAA. But TV ratings are on the rise—more than 3.6 million viewers watched the 2019 championship game, up 24% from 2016—which means a more lucrative broadcast deal could be on the horizon. The women’s tournament kicks off tomorrow in a “bubble” in San Antonio.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eFor gamblers: \u003c/strong\u003eResearch from PlayUSA projects that this year’s tournament could generate as much as \u003ca href=\"https://www.foxbusiness.com/sports/2021-ncaa-march-madness-fans-opening-wallets-in-big-way?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003e$1.5 billion\u003c/a\u003e in legal bets. For context, Legal Sports Report estimated that $462.4 million was legally wagered on this year’s Super Bowl.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eInvestors are getting in on the action. Yesterday, shares of Barstool Sports owner Penn National Gaming and sports betting app DraftKings jumped 4.9% and 6.5%, respectively. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003e+ Some fun bracket math to take you into the weekend.\u003c/strong\u003e According to the NCAA, the odds of filling out a perfect bracket are 1-in-9,223,372,036,854,775,808 (if you just guess or flip a coin) and 1-in-120.2 billion (if you know a little something about basketball). \u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding-top: 12px;\"\u003e\n\u003ca href=\"https://www.facebook.com/sharer/sharer.php?u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.morningbrew.com%2Fdaily%2Fstories%2F2021%2F03%2F19%2Fbusiness-march-madness\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"text-decoration: none;\" class=\"\"\u003e\n\u003cimg alt=\"\" style=\"display: inline-block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;\" width=\"670\" class=\"story-header-image\" src=\"https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC80MjA0L3ZhY2NpbmVfdHJhY2tlci5KUEciLCJidWNrZXQiOiJvc2xvLXByb2R1Y3Rpb24iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;\"\u003e\n\u003csmall\u003e\u003cem\u003eFrancis Scialabba\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eIn the US...\u003c/strong\u003ewe’ve now administered more than 100 million doses, a goal President Biden set out to achieve in his first 100 days in office (it’s his 59th today). Nearly a \u003ca href=\"https://www.washingtonpost.com/graphics/2020/health/covid-vaccine-states-distribution-doses/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003equarter of all Americans\u003c/a\u003e have received at least one dose of a Covid-19 vaccine. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eAcross the world...\u003c/strong\u003ewe’re getting close to half a billion vaccine doses administered. As of last night, 133 countries had given out more than 420 million shots.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eThe latest headlines\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eAstra drama: \u003c/strong\u003eThe WHO \u003ca href=\"https://www.reuters.com/article/us-health-coronavirus-who-astrazeneca/keep-using-astrazeneca-vaccine-who-urges-world-idUSKBN2BB1UL?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eurged the world\u003c/a\u003e to continue using AstraZeneca’s vaccine following blood clot concerns in Europe. UK Prime Minister Boris Johnson \u003ca href=\"https://www.axios.com/boris-johnson-first-dose-astrazeneca-vaccine-42e17216-fee1-457c-ae96-f95b769b4b89.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003egot the Astra shot\u003c/a\u003e yesterday to show it can be trusted.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThird waves:\u003c/strong\u003e The German health minister warned that Covid-19 cases are rising at an “\u003ca href=\"https://www.dw.com/en/germany-weighs-longer-covid-lockdown-amid-exponential-rise/a-56924921?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eexponential rate\u003c/a\u003e” and the pace of the vaccine rollout isn’t fast enough to prevent a third wave. Paris entered lockdown mode yesterday. Meanwhile, Brazil’s health system is in a \u003ca href=\"https://www.theguardian.com/world/2021/mar/19/brazil-coronavirus-intensive-care-unit-capacity?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003estate of crisis\u003c/a\u003e as cases surge.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eMore eligibility: \u003c/strong\u003eFlorida is \u003ca href=\"https://www.nbcmiami.com/news/local/gov-ron-desantis-to-lower-vaccine-eligibility-age-to-50-and-over/2409609/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eopening up\u003c/a\u003e vaccine eligibility to anyone 50 or over starting Monday.\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003e collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe Chinese government is putting the Technoking on notice. It’s a) banned Teslas from entering military complexes and housing compounds and b) curbed the use of Teslas by military staff and employees of key state-owned companies, per \u003ca href=\"https://www.reuters.com/article/us-tesla-china/tesla-cars-banned-from-chinas-military-complexes-on-security-concerns-sources-idUSKBN2BB18R?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003emultiple\u003c/a\u003e \u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/china-to-restrict-tesla-usage-by-military-and-state-personnel-11616155643?mod=hp_lead_pos2\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ereports\u003c/a\u003e. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThe explanation: \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003eBeijing thinks Teslas could be the 21st-century version of the Trojan horse. The government is reportedly worried that the cars’ built-in cameras could collect sensitive data and potentially send it back to the US.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eIf you’re having déjà vu, it’s because the White House has blocked Chinese tech companies from operating in the US due to similar concerns over snooping. Remember Huawei? \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eWhy it matters for Tesla: \u003c/strong\u003eChina is a \u003ca href=\"https://finance.yahoo.com/news/china-restricting-tesla-use-uncovers-a-significant-challenge-for-elon-musk-expert-161921664.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ecritical market\u003c/a\u003e for the company, so it wants to avoid any political controversies as it makes inroads. Chinese sales accounted for about 21% of Tesla’s total revenue in 2020, and with a new Shanghai Gigafactory churning out the Model 3 and Model Y, it wants that share to grow. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp billion. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eZoom out: \u003c/strong\u003eWe’ll find out soon whether
